bibl.title: Thomas Kerr v. William Cochrane. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington, County of King, } ss
In Justice's Court, Seattle Precinct, King County, W.T. before N. SODERBERG, J.P.
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, PLAINTIFF, vs. Thomas Kerr DEFENDANT.
TO H.G. Thornton and the keeper of the jail of said King County, W.T.

WHEREAS, at a Justice's Court held at my office, in said county, for the trial of Thomas Kerr for the offense hereinafter stated, the said Thomas Kerr was convicted of having, on the 13 day of December 1888, in said county, committed Vagrancy and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that said Thomas Kerr should give a bond in $50 for his good behavior for 90 days to the Territory of Washington and stand committed 90 days or until the same be paid : and, whereas, the said Thomas Kerr has made default in the payment of the same. Therefore, you, the said Thomas Kerr are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said Thomas Kerr to the said keeper; and you, the said keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said Thomas Kerr into your custody in said jail, and him there keep at hard labor for the space of 90 days, unless said fine and costs be sooner paid, or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 15th day of December 1888 N. Soderberg, Justice of the Peace
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, vs Thos. Kerr
